name: typescript-express-graphql-seed
description: TypeScript + Express + Apollo Server + Apollo Engine + GraphQL

scripts.dev1: npm run build:dev && cross-env NODE_ENV_ID=1 node build/compiled
scripts.dev2: npm run build:dev && cross-env NODE_ENV_ID=2 node build/compiled
scripts.dev3: npm run build:dev && cross-env NODE_ENV_ID=3 node build/compiled
scripts.test1: npm run build:stage && cross-env NODE_ENV_ID=1 node build/compiled
scripts.test2: npm run build:stage && cross-env NODE_ENV_ID=2 node build/compiled
scripts.test3: npm run build:stage && cross-env NODE_ENV_ID=3 node build/compiled
scripts.prod: npm run check-vuln && npm run build:prod && cross-env NODE_ENV_ID=1 node build/compiled
scripts.postinstall: npm run check-vuln && npm run prepare-folders && npm run hints
scripts.build:dev: npm run clean && npm run prepare-folders && node node_modules/webpack/bin/webpack.js --config config/webpack.config.js
scripts.build:stage: npm run clean && npm run prepare-folders && node node_modules/webpack/bin/webpack.js --config config/webpack.stage.config.js
scripts.build:prod: npm run clean && npm run prepare-folders && node node_modules/webpack/bin/webpack.js --config config/webpack.production.config.js
scripts.hints: echo-cli In case you had not already done so please create your schema into the graphql folder, run the local the server and then run 'prepare-graphql' to automatically create interfaces. Enjoy!
scripts.prepare-graphql: npm run gql2ts && npm run get-schema && npm run generate-fragments

author: Marcello Barile <marcello.barile@gmail.com>
